# Software Requirements Specification
## Traffic Monitoring System

*Auto-generated by Compliance Coder V-Model Engine*
*Generated: 2026-01-11T11:14:01.388Z*

---

## Document Overview

This document specifies the software requirements for Traffic Monitoring System.
Requirements are derived from analyzed code functionality and follow ASPICE SWE.1 standards.

**Traceability:** REQ → ARCH → DESIGN → CODE (each level traces to adjacent levels)

## Requirements


### REQ-001: Real-Time Object Detection Accuracy

**Priority:** critical
**Feature:** F1

**Description:**
The system shall detect and classify objects such as cars, bikes, and pedestrians with an accuracy of at least 90% in real-time.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The detection accuracy shall be measured using a standard dataset with labeled objects, achieving at least 90% precision and recall.
- The system shall be tested under various lighting and weather conditions to ensure consistent performance.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-001, ARCH-002
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-001

---


### REQ-002: Real-Time Processing Speed

**Priority:** critical
**Feature:** F1

**Description:**
The system shall process video frames and detect objects with a latency of no more than 100 milliseconds per frame.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall be tested using a video stream of at least 30 frames per second, ensuring that the average processing time per frame does not exceed 100 milliseconds.
- The system shall maintain this latency under varying traffic conditions and object densities.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-001, ARCH-003
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-002

---


### REQ-003: Object Classification Range

**Priority:** critical
**Feature:** F1

**Description:**
The system shall be capable of detecting and classifying at least three types of objects: cars, bikes, and pedestrians.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall correctly identify and classify each object type in at least 95% of test cases involving mixed traffic scenarios.
- The classification results shall be logged and reviewed for accuracy against a ground truth dataset.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-003
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-003

---


### REQ-004: Multi-Class Detection Capability

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F2

**Description:**
The system shall detect and classify vehicles into at least three categories: cars, bikes, and pedestrians.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall correctly identify and classify 95% of vehicles in a controlled test environment with a diverse dataset.
- The system shall provide real-time classification results within 200 milliseconds of detection.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-003
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-004

---


### REQ-005: Data Logging for Traffic Analysis

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F2

**Description:**
The system shall log detected classes and their counts for traffic analysis purposes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall store detection data in a structured format, including timestamp, class type, and count, for at least 30 days.
- The system shall allow retrieval of logged data for analysis with a query response time of less than 1 second.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-001
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-005

---


### REQ-006: User Notification of Detection Events

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F2

**Description:**
The system shall notify the user of detected classes and their counts in real-time.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall send notifications to the user interface within 1 second of detection.
- The system shall display the detected classes and their respective counts in a user-friendly format.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-001
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-006

---


### REQ-007: Custom Class Mapping Configuration

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F3

**Description:**
The system shall allow the user to define custom class mappings for detected traffic classes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The user shall be able to input a mapping configuration file in JSON format.
- The system shall validate the mapping configuration against predefined schema rules and report any errors.
- The system shall apply the custom mappings to the detected traffic data and output the results accordingly.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-004
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-008: Dynamic Class Mapping Update

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F3

**Description:**
The system shall support dynamic updates to class mappings without requiring a restart.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The user shall be able to modify the class mappings through a dedicated API endpoint.
- The system shall immediately reflect the changes in the output of detected traffic classes after a successful update.
- The system shall log all changes made to class mappings for auditing purposes.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-004
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-009: Class Mapping Validation

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F3

**Description:**
The system shall validate the custom class mappings against existing traffic data to ensure relevance.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall provide a report indicating the effectiveness of the custom mappings based on historical traffic data.
- The user shall receive feedback on the number of classes successfully mapped versus unmapped.
- The system shall allow the user to revert to default mappings if the custom mappings do not meet a predefined effectiveness threshold.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-004
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-010: Model Configuration Input Validation

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F4

**Description:**
The system shall validate the YOLO model configuration inputs to ensure they conform to the expected format and value ranges.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall reject any configuration input that does not meet the specified format, returning an appropriate error message.
- The system shall accept valid configuration inputs and proceed to apply the changes without errors.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-002
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-007

---


### REQ-011: Model Configuration Persistence

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F4

**Description:**
The system shall persist the modified YOLO model configuration to a configuration file or database upon successful validation.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall confirm that the configuration changes have been successfully saved by retrieving the configuration from the storage and verifying it matches the input.
- The system shall maintain the previous configuration state in case of a failure during the save process, ensuring no data loss.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-008

---


### REQ-012: Model Configuration Feedback Mechanism

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F4

**Description:**
The system shall provide feedback to the user regarding the success or failure of the model configuration changes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall display a success message upon successful configuration changes.
- The system shall display an error message detailing the reason for failure if the configuration changes cannot be applied.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-009

---


### REQ-013: Video Feed Loading

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F5

**Description:**
The system shall load video feeds from specified file paths or URLs.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall successfully load video feeds from at least 95% of valid file paths or URLs provided.
- The system shall return an error message for invalid file paths or URLs within 2 seconds.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-014: Video Feed Processing

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F5

**Description:**
The system shall process loaded video feeds to extract frames for object detection.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall extract and process frames at a minimum rate of 30 frames per second for standard video formats.
- The system shall maintain a processing accuracy of at least 90% for object detection on the extracted frames.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD

---


### REQ-015: Error Handling for Video Input

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F5

**Description:**
The system shall handle errors gracefully when loading video feeds.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall log error messages for any failed video feed loads, with timestamps and error codes.
- The system shall provide user feedback indicating the reason for failure within 3 seconds of the load attempt.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: TBD
- Verified by (System Tests): TBD
